[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: get_account_resources()] [Cursor Forgery] Can an attacker craft StateKeyWrapper cursors that skip validation and point to arbitrary state keys, enabling cross-account data leakage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::resources()] [Cursor Header Injection] Can malicious next_state_key values injected into X-Aptos-Cursor headers cause client-side parsing errors or security issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: get_account()] [Historical State Poison] Can requesting very old ledger versions cause the API to load corrupted or tampered historical state that was previously pruned incorrectly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::resources()] [Version Drift] Can concurrent API requests with no specified version observe state from different ledger versions, breaking client assumptions about state consistency? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::balance()] [Resource Group Key] Can StateKey::resource_group be exploited to access resource groups from unintended accounts by manipulating the primary_fungible_store_address? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::resources()] [Pagination Start Key] Can the start StateKey parameter bypass access control by pointing to state keys outside the target account's keyspace? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::balance()] [Balance Addition Overflow] Can balance += operations overflow when summing coin_balance, fa_store_resource.balance(), and concurrent_fa_balance_resource.balance()? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::resources()] [Limit Multiplication] Can determine_limit * resource_size calculations overflow when processing accounts with maximum resources and maximum page sizes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::modules()] [Module Size Accumulation] Can summing module bytecode sizes overflow u64 when an account has many large modules, causing incorrect memory allocation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::account()] [Feature Flag TOCTOU] Can feature_enabled(DEFAULT_ACCOUNT_RESOURCE) check be exploited through TOCTOU where the feature flag changes between check and usage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/src/accounts.rs] [Function: Account::balance()] [Silent Failures] Can balance calculation errors be silently ignored, causing zero balances to be returned even when errors occur during resource lookups? (Medium)
